channel.title: Tags/VFX on Seb Hirsch - Motion Design & Visual Effects
channel.description: Recent content in Tags/VFX on Seb Hirsch - Motion Design & Visual Effects

item.title: Cloudy Clouds
item.description: Visual effects artist for Cloudy Clouds.

item.title: One Day I'll Become
item.description: Created the 3D model of the Millennium Falcon for this VFX short film.

item.title: Star Trek Into Darkness
item.description:
Contributed as a Matte Painter at Pixomondo for the 2013 blockbuster Star Trek Into Darkness.

The work involved creating large-scale futuristic environments and set extensions, blending digital painting with 3D elements to define the visual scape of the J.J. Abrams sequel.

item.title: Raw Dusk
item.description: A visual effects short or personal project from around 2014 focusing on intense atmospheric lighting and mood.

item.title: Game of Thrones
item.description:
Sebastian worked as a VFX/Environment Artist at Pixomondo for the acclaimed HBO series Game of Thrones.

He was part of the talented team recognized with a Primetime Emmy Award in 2012 for Outstanding Special Visual Effects for Season 2. His work involved creating complex digital environments and seamless integration to bring the world of Westeros to life.

item.title: The Avengers
item.description:
Served as a Senior Lighting and Shading Artist at Scanline VFX, contributing to the complex digital environments of the Marvel blockbuster The Avengers (2012).

The project required precise shading and lighting of digital assets to integrate perfectly with live-action footage during the intense battle sequences.

item.title: Looper
item.description: Worked as a Senior Visual Effects Artist at Scanline VFX for the 2012 sci-fi thriller Looper.

item.title: Der Turm
item.description: Contributed digital matte paintings and 3D artistry for the high-profile 2012 German production Der Turm.

item.title: Zettl
item.description: Contributed digital matte paintings and 3D artistry for the 2012 film Zettl.

item.title: Innocent Saturday (V subbotu)
item.description: Worked as a lighting and shading artist for this drama centered around the Chernobyl disaster.

item.title: Borgia
item.description: Worked as a Digital Matte Painter and Environment Artist at RISE Visual Effects Studios for the historical TV series Borgia.

item.title: Hotel Lux
item.description: Served as the Shading & Texturing Lead for the 2011 film Hotel Lux, handling the recreation of historical digital environments of Moscow and Berlin.

item.title: Westflug – Entführung aus Liebe
item.description: Responsible for shading and texturing on this historical TV movie, contributing to the visual fidelity of the period setting.

item.title: The Last Airbender
item.description: Served as a Digital Matte Artist, creating the epic landscapes for M. Night Shyamalan’s 2010 adaptation The Last Airbender.

item.title: The Ghost Writer
item.description: Provided visual effects for Roman Polanski’s 2010 thriller The Ghost Writer.
Involved in the extensive disaster visual effects that defined the 2009 film 2012.

item.title: Clouds Over the Hill (坂の上の雲)
item.description: Contributed visual effects to Clouds Over the Hill (Saka no Ue no Kumo), a large-scale Japanese historical drama series produced by NHK.

item.title: Berlin 36
item.description:
One of Sebastian’s most technical achievements was creating the “Krautsimulation” for the 2009 film Berlin 36.

This involved a digital recreation of the Berlin Olympic Stadium filled with 90,000 computer-generated characters for extensive set extensions.

item.title: Wickie und die starken Männer
item.description: Provided visual effects for the 2009 live-action adaptation of the classic cartoon Wickie und die starken Männer.

item.title: 1 ½ Ritter – Auf der Suche nach der hinreißenden Herzelinde
item.description: Worked as a visual effects artist at Scanline VFX for the 2008 medieval comedy 1 ½ Ritter – Auf der Suche nach der hinreißenden Herzelinde.

item.title: (T)Raumschiff Surprise – Periode 1
item.description: Worked as a Lighting Artist at Scanline for Michael “Bully” Herbig’s highly successful 2004 sci-fi parody (T)Raumschiff Surprise – Periode 1.
